page.title: 15Housing in Brinklow
page.content: Brinklow has a wide variety of both very old and more modern housing.Many houses built along Broad St.and The Crescent and around small cobbled yards leading from these two roads are pre-1700 with the 2 oldest houses being situated on the corner of Ell Lane.Some houses have been built by the council for their tenants but many of these are now owner-occupied.The terraced and semi-detached houses in Coventry Rd.,Heath Lane and Yew Tree Hill were built in the 1930s,while those in Great Balance,Skipwith Close and George Birch Close were built in the early 1970s.Potters Close contains some pre-fabs. built in the early 1940s.The housing that has been built by private builders includes the bungalows in Colledge Close and the larger houses in Ell Lane.
